page.title: 06The River Fal: Background
page.content: In our D_block the River Fal flows SSW from Tregony to Grampound.This page deals with the river's historical significance and the next page with its morphology.Next to Creed Church there was said to be a place called Hallbote where boats were tied up.Tregony used to be a thriving port.Part of the Fal is now silted up due to the tinners' tin-streaming activities and waste flowing downriver.This part of the Fal flows through Trewithen Estate;whose ownership has passed down through a single family for many generations. Golden mill used to provide grain for Golden Manor in the 17th century but it has fallen into disuse. The hill fort shown on the O.S. map(924468) is of either Roman or Iron Age origin.
